title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Reviews of the laws of motion, Dynamics of a particle in two or three dimensions, equations of motion of an aircraft treated as a particle, Dynamics of a system of particles, collision and orbit problems, rockets. Dynamics of rigid bodies: kinematics of rigid bodies in two and three dimensions, equations of motion and their solution for selected cases, equations of motion of a rigid aircraft, gyroscopes, Introduction to the principle of virtual work and Lagrangian mechanics. Books:I H Shames, Engineering Mechanics: Statics and Dynamics, Prentice-HallJ L Meriam and L G Kraige, Engineering Mechanics: Dynamics, John Wiley and SonsF P Beer and E R Johnston, Vector Mechanics for Engineers â Statics and Dynamics, McGraw-Hill

title: Concepts taught in class
text: Dynamics of single particle and system of particles, Orbital mechanics, Rocket Dynamics

title: Student Opinion
text: It builds on the mechanics course of first year

title: How to Crack the Paper
text: The paper has good conceptual questions and it is required to practice many questions from the prescribed textbooks apart from the tutorial.
